rationales.power: Dr. Salwa talked over his patient update and the resident pivoted to her, directly undermining his authority during handoff. He accepted the subordination by not interrupting and waiting silently.
rationales.conformity: Despite feeling diminished, he restrained himself from interrupting, avoided conflict, and resumed his report as if nothing happened — maintaining social smoothness over asserting his position.

rationales.self_direction: His autonomy is constrained by institutional bureaucracy — he followed every correct step but has no control over the outcome, dependent on a clerk he has never met to approve his clinical judgment.
rationales.power: He explicitly experiences loss of status: 'Like I am back to being a junior nurse asking permission to change a dressing.' Despite 28 years of experience, he has no more procurement authority than a fresh graduate.

rationales.achievement: He proactively caught a missing signature on discharge paperwork that would have bounced back from records, demonstrating diligent competence and maintaining high standards on his floor.

rationales.self_direction: He surrendered his own clinical judgment — he wrote the current protocol and knows it works, but gave in to avoid being labeled 'the old guard resisting change' rather than standing by his assessment.
rationales.power: His expertise was overruled by a newer doctor and management without consulting any bedside nurse; 'the committee that rewrote it did not consult a single bedside nurse' and the unit manager sided with Dr. Fares over him.
rationales.conformity: He explicitly chose to fall in line: 'I said fine' and accepted the new policy to avoid social friction and the stigma of being labeled resistant to change.

rationales.power: He perceives the mentoring request as 'containment' — a check on whether he will fall in line. His authority and judgment have been overridden, and now he is being asked to carry someone else's decision to the team.
rationales.conformity: Despite resenting it, he will comply fully: 'I will teach Hana and the others exactly how the new protocol works, and I will do it well, because that is what I do.' He restrains his dissent and conforms to institutional expectations.

rationales.power: As chair of the council, Abu Fadi talked over him three times during his budget presentation and everyone just sat there — his authority in a leadership role he holds was directly undermined.
rationales.conformity: He restrained himself from shutting Abu Fadi down to avoid rallying opposition among older residents: 'I let him talk and then I steer the vote.' He prioritized social harmony over asserting his authority.

rationales.power: His seniority-based status is not recognized by the new scheduling system; a nurse with two years of experience has the same standing as him. His request for his daughter's orientation is treated as negotiable despite 30 years of service.
rationales.benevolence: The underlying action is driven by care for his daughter — he is fighting to attend her university orientation, prioritizing her important life milestone.

rationales.tradition: The morning reflects cultural traditions: the mother insisting on paying ('a mother's duty does not expire'), stopping at Abu Mahmoud's bakery for knafeh, and the warm familial customs around the visit.
rationales.benevolence: He took his mother to her cardiology appointment before his shift, spent quality time with her eating knafeh in the car, and attended to her wellbeing — clear prioritization of close family care.

rationales.self_direction: He resisted the committee's proposal by voicing his independent assessment that continuity matters, and strategically bought time by offering written feedback rather than simply accepting the decision — 'my way of not surrendering while buying time.'
rationales.power: The 'shared leadership' proposal would strip his permanent charge nurse role; he recognizes it as a move to flatten the hierarchy so 'no one person has enough standing to push back on administrative decisions.' His leadership position is being systematically dismantled.
